alert.note: Alert for Baltimore City (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 9:54AM EDT until June 14 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following county: Baltimore and Baltimore City. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM EDT, flooding was reported along Harris Lane in Baltimore, and standing water was reported on Interstate 695 near Exit 35. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Middle River... Back River... Millers Island... Sparrows Point... North Point State Park... Dundalk... Towson... Essex... Parkville... Carney... Perry Hall... Rosedale... Rossville... White Marsh... Bowleys Quarters... Kingsville... Edgewood... Joppatowne... Edgemere... - Please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
